alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jefferson; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:23PM CDT until April 04 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... North central Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Jackson County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 822 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Denton to 5 miles south of Hoyt, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, McLouth, Hoyt, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Winchester, Mayetta and Denison. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
